result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:35 AM Prosecuting attorney John Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shavelle Campbell in court.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Shavelle Campbell. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  This case has not been past prelim.  Defense files a bond motion.  State is in Marcy's Law compliance.  Defense makes further argument on the bond motion.  The State takes no position.  BTC: Bond modification adjusted down to $3000 cash, same conditions.
atty McClure
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shavelle Campbell in court.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Shavelle Campbell. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Attorney McClure is going to be appointed on this file by the court.
Defense moves to address bond, requesting it be modified to a signature bond, reasoning stated on the record- ultimately requesting bond be returned to the surety to allow for a financial concern stated on the record. 
BTC: Bond motion cannot be heard based upon the request, defense needs to file a motion.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shavelle Campbell in court. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant requests a refund of his bond money to use funds to retain counsel.

BTC: Court cannot address bond as victim notification has not been given. Court will grant PFAC at a repayment of $25 a month to start in 60 days.
